subject: Re: [junit] Documenting test cases
msgSnippet: ... Like JB, I use throws Exception for all my tests. If I ever get the urge to document exceptions I would write a fail() test demonstrating the exceptional
messageBody:
David Plass wrote:

> What about the documentation? If I declare more specific exceptions, a la
>
> public void testAFile() throws FileNotFoundException {
> ...
> }
>
> then I can document why it might fail:
> @throws FileNotFoundException when the test file "foo" is not found, but
> it should always be found. This might indicate a problem with ...

Like JB, I use throws Exception for all my tests. If I ever get the
urge to document exceptions I would write a fail() test
demonstrating the exceptional behaviour.

cheers
Bill
